A: It is a mind sport where participants write computer programs to solve mathematical and logical puzzles.
Contestants are typically judged on how correct and efficient their programs are and how fast they solved the problem.
Here's a great video explaining competitive programming.

entries.Q: What programming languages do I need to know?
A: As the contest will be run on DMOJ, you should be familiar with at least one of the allowed languages.

entries.Q: What do I do if it says "access denied" on the contest page?
A: Make sure you are logged into DMOJ and your account is part of the RHHS organization.
To join the RHHS organization, make sure you are logged in, then head over to this link and click the blue "Join organization" button.

entries.Q: How long will the contest be?
A: You will have 2 hours and 30 minutes for the contest, from 3:45 P.M. to 6:15 P.M.

entries.Q: How can I practice for competitive programming contests?
A: There are many great online judges with large problemsets that you can use to practice, such as DMOJ, LeetCode, Codeforces and HackerRank.

entries.Q: How can I get in touch with the RHHS CS Club?
A: You can email us at rhhs.compsci@gmail.com or message us on instagram @rhhs.cs.club.
